text:
cer
		                    Treatment of stage I renal cell cancer may include the following:         -  Surgery (radical nephrectomy, simple nephrectomy, or partial nephrectomy).     -  Radiation therapy as palliative therapy to relieve symptoms in patients who cannot have surgery.    -  Arterial embolization as palliative therapy.     - A clinical trial of a new treatment.        Check the list of NCI-supported cancer clinical trials that are now accepting patients with stage I renal cell cancer
